docs.lead_paragraph: A report found that diabetes drugs that have been around for years are more effective and often work with fewer side effects than the newest drugs.

headline.seo: For Diabetes, Older Drugs Are Often the Best

docs.lead_paragraph: Forgive me for sounding like a broken record, to use a highly retro phrase, but the evidence on overtesting and overtreatment of older adults keeps piling higher.

headline.main: Unnecessary Colon Screenings for Elderly Patients

docs.abstract: Older patients are getting too many routine colonscopies, a new study finds.
docs.snippet: Older patients are getting too many routine colonscopies, a new study finds.

docs.lead_paragraph: The discovery that many Asian-American girls were vulnerable to being lured into the sex trade led to a change in how the medical and legal systems treated these girls.

headline.main: In Oakland, Redefining Sex Trade Workers as Abuse Victims
headline.sub: Struggles Over Cultural Identity Leave Girls Vulnerable To the Lure Of the Streets;
headline.print_headline: In Oakland, Redefining Sex Trade Workers as Abuse Victims

docs.snippet: The discovery that many Asian-American girls were vulnerable to being lured into the sex trade led to a change in how the medical and legal systems treated these girls.

docs.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif. -- Dr. Kimberly Chang, a physician at a community clinic in Chinatown, will never forget the first young girl she suspected had been sold for sex. Kalea, a 15-year-old Cambodian-American girl who grew up in Oakland, kept coming in to be examined for sexually transmitted diseases, the beginning of a grim cycle of diagnosis and treatment. ''I started asking, 'Are you having sex with new people?' '' Dr. Chang, 37, recalled. ''It was always, 'No, no, no, no, no.' Eventually she confided that she was worried about 'a friend.' That's when I asked, 'Are you trading sex for money?' ''

headline.main: In Oakland, Redefining Sex Trade Workers as Abuse Victims

docs.abstract: Asian Health Services clinic in Chinatown section of Oakland, Calif, is in the vanguard of a new public health approach to treating American-born minors lured into the sex trade; new programs view them as victims of child abuse and focus on early intervention and counseling; photos (M)
docs.snippet: The discovery that many Asian-American girls were vulnerable to being lured into the sex trade led to a change in how the medical and legal systems treated these girls.

docs.lead_paragraph: New studies have raised hopes for curbing transmission — if H.I.V. patients take treatment long before they feel sick.

headline.main: Drugs Stop AIDS. Take Your Medicine.
